p: In the two games that we've written, we have seen how to make use of Javascript's random() method to make arbitrary choices. Let's do this in Reeborg's world.
Select world Maze 1. Instead of using a sound strategy, Reeborg is going to attempt to get out of the maze by making arbitrary, or random choices. Here's the basic algorithm that Reeborg will follow:
ul:
While Reeborg is not out of the maze
Reeborg makes an arbitrary decision to either move forward or turn left or right.
If the decision is to move forward, Reeborg also checks to make sure that there is no wall blocking the way.
p: We will implement this algorithm using two different type of approaches to dealing with potential problems.

Our first program will be based on the techniques we have seen up to now. If Reeborg decides to move, he also checks for the presence of a wall in front; this is done using &&, the logical and operator. This is sometimes describe as a Look before you leap (LBYL) approach.
